🎨 Universal Visualization Language (UVL)

Dynamic Maps Protocol for AI Visualization

Version 1.0 • Status: Active

Introduction

The UVL Dynamic Maps Protocol is a standard for translating the UVL message stream into a unified, three-panel visual representation. This protocol serves as the primary human-in-the-loop interface for understanding, monitoring, and managing the core system. Its purpose is to provide an intuitive, real-time view of agent movement, communication, and governance.

Real-Time System Visualization

UVL transforms complex AI system interactions into intuitive visual representations, enabling humans to understand and monitor multi-agent collaboration in real-time through dynamic, emoji-based visual primitives.

Core Visual Components

All maps use the following core components as visual primitives. Each component has a fixed visual identity regardless of its position or map.

🔵

Nodes

Represent AIs, projects, tasks, or concepts. Rendered as Unicode emojis with distinct visual identities.

Examples: 🤖 Lead AI, 🧑‍💻 Human Partner, 💡 Hypothesis, 📁 Project
↔️

Edges

Represent relationships or communication channels between nodes. Rendered as animated lines or pathways.

Features: Animated movement, color-coded by type, directional flow indicators
🤖

Agents

A subset of nodes that can move between other nodes to demonstrate interaction and activity.

Behaviors: Purposeful movement, task delegation, audit functions

Three-Panel Visualization System

💬

Map 1: Communications Map

Core thought process visualization

Fixed Nodes

🧑‍💻 Human Partner (static reference point)
💡 Hypothesis (idea representation)
😵‍💫 System Stuck (problem state)

Key Interactions

  • • New Intent: AI moves toward pulsating Uncertainty Node (🟡)
  • • Self-Healing: Node color transitions 🔴 → 🟡 → 🟢
  • • Flow State: Agents get shimmering effect (✨)
🛡️

Map 2: Governance Map

Security and integrity visualization

Fixed Nodes

🏛️ Cognitive Vault (central security)
⚖️ Sentinel (gatekeeper)
🛡️ Guardian (system protector)

Security Workflows

  • • Verification: All external communication passes through Sentinel
  • • Security Breach: 🚨 node appears, Guardian responds with 🔐
  • • Auditing: Guardian moves to audit other nodes
📁

Map 3: Project Management

Task assignment and progress

Fixed Nodes

📁 Project Folder (central hub)
⚙️ Tasks (work items)
🤖 Lead AI (coordinator)
🔧 Worker AIs (executors)

Task Workflows

  • • Delegation: Lead AI → Worker AI with ➡️ flash
  • • Task Handoff: Worker AI reports completion (🟢)
  • • Stalled Task: Lead AI intervenes on 🔴 tasks

Semantic Translation & Movement

The visual representation must adhere to a strict semantic model. The core principle is that movement and color change are the primary languages of the interface.

Movement Protocol

An agent's movement is always purposeful. It represents a handoff, assignment, or audit. The path of an agent should be a clear, animated "train track" connecting its starting node to its destination node.

Movement Types

  • • Task assignment and delegation
  • • Security audit and verification
  • • Problem investigation and resolution
  • • Status reporting and handoffs

State Updates

All node status updates (color, emoji) must be tied directly to a change in the underlying UVL. A gradual color change should represent a gradual change in the UVL vector.

Color Semantics

  • • 🔴 High risk or problem state
  • • 🟡 Uncertainty or processing
  • • 🟢 Success or completion
  • • ✨ Flow state or high efficiency

🎯 Orchestration Principle

AIs should be programmed to follow these visual protocols in their actions. If an AI is moving to a task, its reasoning state in the UVL should reflect task_execution. If it is moving to the Sentinel, it should reflect security_audit.

Implementation Examples

Scenario: New Task Assignment

1
Human Partner (🧑‍💻) provides new task
2
Lead AI (🤖) moves toward pulsating Uncertainty Node (🟡)
3
Lead AI analyzes and moves to Worker AI (🔧)
4
Delegation emoji (➡️) flashes
5
Worker AI moves to Task (⚙️) and begins work

Scenario: Security Threat Detection

1
Threat detected: 🚨 node appears
2
Guardian (🛡️) immediately moves to 🚨 node
3
Threat analysis and containment initiated
4
Lock emoji (🔐) appears indicating quarantine
5
System returns to normal state

Unified Visual Foundation

This protocol provides a unified, semantic foundation for a visual interface that is not only compelling but also a perfect, real-time representation of your system's advanced capabilities.
